p: ACE2 is particularly expressed on the type II alveolar epithelial cells (Guan et al. 2020a; Guan et al. 2020b; Wang and Xu 2020; Yang et al. 2020a; Yang et al. 2020b; Yang et al. 2020c; Zhao et al. 2020) although also the gastrointestinal tract, kidneys, heart, brain stem, vasculature, liver, and nasal and oral mucosa express these receptors, contributing to extra-pulmonary manifestations (Zhao et al. 2020). However, the different distribution of ACE2 in organs and tissue is significantly correlated to the clinical symptoms of SARS-CoV-2 infection (Nejadi Babadaei et al. 2020) (Fig.Â 4).
